title: Scientific study to be conducted to minimize crop damage by wild animals
byline: A committee comprising government officials and experts has been appointed under the leadership of Secretary to the President, Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake to seek and implement sustainable solutions to manage and control the damages caused by wild animals to food production through a scientific approach.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today (20), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Trump to decide on US action in Israel-Iran war within two weeks, White House says
byline: US President Donald Trump will decide in the next two weeks whether the U.S. will get involved in the Israel-Iran air war, the White House said on Thursday, raising pressure on Tehran to come to the negotiating table.

title: Nearly 2,000 killed in road accidents during first half of 2025
byline: Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Police for Traffic Control and Road Safety, Indika Hapugoda, has revealed that nearly 2,000 people have lost their lives in fatal road accidents during the first six months of 2025.

title: Sri Lanka Customs earns Rs. 165 bln from vehicle imports this year
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has announced that it has earned a revenue of around Rs. 165 billion from vehicle imports alone so far this year, following the government’s decision to lift the ban on automobile imports.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam to continue until 2029, says Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Education and Higher Education, Dr. Madhura Senevirathna, has confirmed that the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination will not be suspended immediately.

title: More Sri Lankans expected to leave Israel in the coming days
byline: Necessary arrangements will be made to assist Sri Lankans working in Israel to leave the country at any given time if required, Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to Israel Nimal Bandara has stated.

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa granted bail
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa, has been granted bail after being produced before the Fort Magistrate’s Court today (20), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: 85 Chinese nationals deported from Sri Lanka over criminal offenses
byline: The Officer-in-Charge of Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake, has confirmed that a total of 85 Chinese nationals involved in various criminal activities, including cybercrimes, were deported from Sri Lanka this morning (June 20) via a special SriLankan Airlines flight.

title: NPP Chairman of Balangoda Pradeshiya Sabha resigns
byline: Ranjith Udaya Kumara, who was elected to the Balangoda Pradeshiya Sabha representing the National People’s Power (NPP), has officially resigned from his position as Chairman of the Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: 44 vehicles including buses temporarily taken off the road over safety concerns
byline: Inspection officers from the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) temporarily removed a total of 44 vehicles, including both Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) and private buses, from service during a special inspection conducted on the Hatton–Kandy main road on June 19.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: EU and UK ministers to hold talks with Iran in Geneva
byline: Foreign ministers from the UK, France, and Germany are due to meet their Iranian counterpart, Abbas Araqchi, in Geneva on Friday, as international efforts intensify to ease mounting tensions over Tehran’s nuclear programme.

title: NPP secures power in Galle Municipal Council
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has established power in the Galle Municipal Council following the inaugural council meeting held today (June 20), under the patronage of the Commissioner of Local Government.

title: Chamithri Rambukwella released after meeting bail conditions
byline: Chamithri Jayanika Rambukwella, daughter of former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, who was previously remanded after failing to meet bail conditions, was released on bail today (June 20) after fulfilling the stipulated requirements.

title: Three including DMT Deputy Commissioner further remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (June 20) ordered the further remand of three suspects, including a Deputy Commissioner of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT), who were arrested on bribery charges.

title: Two inmates at Boossa Prison stage roof protest
byline: Two inmates of Boossa Prison commenced a protest today (June 20) by climbing onto the roof of the prison to oppose the intensive searches being conducted inside the facility.

title: NPP secures power in Ukuwela PS and Seruwila PS; SJB takes Beruwala PS
byline: Nimal Karunathilaka, representing the National People’s Power (NPP), has been elected as the Chairman of the Ukuwela Pradeshiya Sabha in Rattota, Matale.

title: SLPP suspends party membership of Galle Deputy Mayor
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has suspended the party membership of Priyantha Godagama Sahabandu, who was elected as the Deputy Mayor of the Galle Municipal Council this morning (20).

title: Sri Lanka’s FDI records 90% increase in first quarter 2025
byline: The Board of Investment (BOI) of Sri Lanka has successfully increased Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) by US$96 million in the first quarter of 2025, compared with the same period in 2024.

title: WATCH: Prince William’s BBC docu-series episode on Sri Lanka’s wildlife rangers
byline: The latest episode of Guardians, the acclaimed wildlife docuseries spearheaded by Prince William and The Royal Foundation’s United for Wildlife programme, has been released — this time spotlighting the brave efforts of Sri Lanka’s wildlife rangers in their fight to save the island’s endangered elephants.

title: Netanyahu faces backlash for calling son’s twice-postponed wedding a ‘personal cost of war’
byline: Standing before the shattered facade of Soroka Medical Center in Beersheba, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delivered a sombre message invoking the spirit of wartime London during the Blitz.

title: Advertisements promoting overseas property investments: Public urged not to be misled
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) advises the public not to be misled by advertisements published in the print and social media, which promote overseas property investments, and also offering guidance on obtaining foreign financing for such purposes.
